PHP Introduction

What is PHP ?
PHP is a widely-used, open-source scripting language designed primarily for web development. It stands for "Hypertext Preprocessor," which is a recursive acronym. PHP can be embedded into HTML, making it easy to add dynamic content to web pages. It is executed on the server side, generating HTML that is sent to the client's browser. PHP supports various databases, including MySQL, and offers a range of functionalities from form handling to session management. Its syntax is similar to C and Java, which makes it accessible to many developers. PHP also has a large ecosystem of frameworks and libraries, facilitating rapid development and deployment of web applications.

Why we learn php ?
  • Ease of use and learn
  • Cost efficiency (open source)
  • Object Oriented Programming
  • Cross-platform compatibility
  • Works with All servers Apache,IIS etc
  • Security
  • Huge Community
Uses of PHP in Web Development :
  • CMS (Content Management System)
  • E-commerce Website
  • Mail Server
  • Chatting System
  • File Storage System
  • ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning)
  • CRM (Customer Relationship Management)
